availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Crum (Johnson County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Mary Mutler Crum on February 20, 1856. Father of Lydia A. Crum, Mary E. Crum, Pleasant B. Crum, Frances G. Crum, Nancy J. Crum, and Sarah M. Crum. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as private from May 21, 1864 to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 36.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Rockcastle, p. 6.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 001912950, p. 37.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 896.
